section.title: Sense object type
section.para: A part of an entry which groups together information relating to one of the (possibly multiple) meanings (or meaning potentials) of the entry's headword.

note.para: An entry is a container for formal properties of the headword such as orthography, morphology, syntax and pronunciation. A sense is a container for statements about the headword's semantics.

listitem.para: Can be implicit from the serialization.
A short statement that indicates the meaning of a sense and permits its differentiation from other senses in the entry.

note.para: Indicators are sometimes used in dictionaries as "mini-definitions" instead of or in addition to regular definitions. They are short, one-word or two-word paraphrases of the sense. Their purpose is to allow the (human) user to find the desired sense quickly.

listitem.para: A long statement that describes and/or explains the meaning of a sense.

note.para: In DMLex, the term definition encompasses not only formal sciency definitions, but also less formal explanations.

example.title: Example of an entry with two senses, each having both an indicator and a definition
